title: GenAI Platform Engineer, Applied Machine Learning
description:
SummaryPosted: Dec 6, 2024Weekly Hours: 40 Role Number:200581427Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there‚Äôs no telling what you could accomplish.

The Applied Machine Learning(AML) Solutions Team build solutions that impact across Apple. Typically these problems are related to Machine Learning Platform & Solutions and Big Data. We work on many high-impact projects that serve various Apple lines of business. We use the latest in open source technology and as committers on some of these projects, we are pushing the envelope. Working with multiple lines of business we manage many streams of Apple-scale data. We bring it all together and unleash business value. 

We do all this with an exceptional group of software engineers, data scientists, DevOps engineers. We are looking for a hardworking and dedicated engineers to join our team to bring passion for applying their ML skills and distributed systems, to build world-class platforms/products at a very large scale across cloud environments.DescriptionThis role will be responsible for defining and developing ML Platform and frameworks for generative AI powered applications. You will collaborate with diverse cross-functional partners, including model developers, machine learning systems engineers, data scientists, application developers and product managers. Our ML Platform allows multi-functional teams to build diverse, business critical ML apps leveraging LLMs. 

This role will also work closely with product and program teams to ensure platform features are developed in lockstep with products roadmap and business user feedbacks. This is a fast-paced role with high visibility, impact, and influence in delivering one of the industry's most advanced generative AI systems.Minimum Qualifications2+ years of industry experience designing, building, and supporting machine learning platforms, services and frameworks.Strong proficiency in embeddings, vectorization, vector stores, database optimization, performance tuning, and relevant query languages.Familiarity with embedding, retrieval algorithms, agents, data modeling for vector development graphs.BS in computer science or related technical degreeStrong understanding of software engineering principles and fundamentals including data structures and algorithms.Solid understanding of concurrency and multi-threading, multiple design patterns and debugging and analytical methodologies.Experience with LLM and other related frameworks like Langchain, LLamaIndexExperience with relevant programming languages, such as Java, Python or Go.Preferred Qualifications7+ years of industry experience designing, building, and supporting machine learning platforms, services and frameworks.Ability to apply your LLM knowledge with a product-oriented focus.Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a collaborative team environment.Strong communication skills, and ability to distill technically complex concepts and data for an intelligent but non-ML audience.Self directed, self motivated and detail oriented with ability to come up with good design proposals and thorough analysis of production issues.Pay & BenefitsAt Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $175,800 and $312,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple‚Äôs discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple‚Äôs Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You‚Äôll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses ‚Äî including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.

GenAI Platform Engineer, Applied Machine Learning

Sunnyvale, California, United States

Full Time Mid-level / Intermediate USD 175K - 312K

Apple

We‚Äôre a diverse collective of thinkers and doers, continually reimagining what‚Äôs possible to help us all do what we love in new ways.

View all jobs at Apple

Apply now Apply later

Posted 1 month ago

Summary

Posted: Dec 6, 2024
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200581427

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there‚Äôs no telling what you could accomplish. The Applied Machine Learning(AML) Solutions Team build solutions that impact across Apple. Typically these problems are related to Machine Learning Platform & Solutions and Big Data. We work on many high-impact projects that serve various Apple lines of business. We use the latest in open source technology and as committers on some of these projects, we are pushing the envelope. Working with multiple lines of business we manage many streams of Apple-scale data. We bring it all together and unleash business value. We do all this with an exceptional group of software engineers, data scientists, DevOps engineers. We are looking for a hardworking and dedicated engineers to join our team to bring passion for applying their ML skills and distributed systems, to build world-class platforms/products at a very large scale across cloud environments.

Description


This role will be responsible for defining and developing ML Platform and frameworks for generative AI powered applications. You will collaborate with diverse cross-functional partners, including model developers, machine learning systems engineers, data scientists, application developers and product managers. Our ML Platform allows multi-functional teams to build diverse, business critical ML apps leveraging LLMs. This role will also work closely with product and program teams to ensure platform features are developed in lockstep with products roadmap and business user feedbacks. This is a fast-paced role with high visibility, impact, and influence in delivering one of the industry's most advanced generative AI systems.

Minimum Qualifications


  • 2+ years of industry experience designing, building, and supporting machine learning platforms, services and frameworks.
  • Strong proficiency in embeddings, vectorization, vector stores, database optimization, performance tuning, and relevant query languages.
  • Familiarity with embedding, retrieval algorithms, agents, data modeling for vector development graphs.
  • BS in computer science or related technical degree
  • Strong understanding of software engineering principles and fundamentals including data structures and algorithms.
  • Solid understanding of concurrency and multi-threading, multiple design patterns and debugging and analytical methodologies.
  • Experience with LLM and other related frameworks like Langchain, LLamaIndex
  • Experience with relevant programming languages, such as Java, Python or Go.


Preferred Qualifications


  • 7+ years of industry experience designing, building, and supporting machine learning platforms, services and frameworks.
  • Ability to apply your LLM knowledge with a product-oriented focus.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
  • Strong communication skills, and ability to distill technically complex concepts and data for an intelligent but non-ML audience.
  • Self directed, self motivated and detail oriented with ability to come up with good design proposals and thorough analysis of production issues.


Pay & Benefits


  • At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $175,800 and $312,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

    Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple‚Äôs discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple‚Äôs Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You‚Äôll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses ‚Äî including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

    Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.



  • Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.
